page.title: 02AGRICULTURE IN FENLAND
page.content: The type of land ranges from light,silt soil by the Nene through heavier silts around the village of Newton to peat on clay at the western end in the fen.The majority of the land is used for{arable farming}and a wide variety of crops are grown including wheat, barley, peas, potatoes, sugarbeet and oil-seed rape. Fruit production is another important aspect.There are several acres of{orchard}which produce apples, pears and plums in different varieties, and{soft fruits}such as strawberries, raspberries and currants are also grown.{Flowers}are an important source of income for several market gardeners, and some farmers also include a few{cows}or{sheep}on their holdings.
